503.description: The cluster does not seem to be provisioned yet.

get.description: Returns a list of all registered deployments, including their endpoints and associated services.

200.description: List of all registered deployments with their metadata

post.description:
Registers a new deployment (HTTP or Lambda). Restate will invoke the endpoint to discover available services and handlers,
and make them available for invocation. For more information, see the [deployment documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/services/versioning#registering-a-deployment).

200.description: Deployment already exists. No change if force = false, services overwritten if force = true

201.description: Deployment created successfully and services discovered

get.description: Returns detailed information about a registered deployment, including deployment metadata and the services it exposes.

200.description: Deployment details including services and configuration

delete.description:
Delete a deployment. Currently, only forced deletions are supported.
**Use with caution**: forcing a deployment deletion can break in-flight invocations.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If true, the deployment will be forcefully deleted. This might break in-flight invocations, use with caution.

202.description: Deployment deletion accepted and will be processed asynchronously

501.description: Not implemented. Graceful deployment deletion (force=false) is not yet supported.

patch.description:
Updates an existing deployment configuration, such as the endpoint address or invocation headers.
By default, service schemas are not re-discovered. Set `overwrite: true` to trigger re-discovery.

200.description: Deployment updated successfully. Address and invocation options are updated. Service schemas are only updated if overwrite was set to true.
The Admin API is ready to accept requests.

patch.description:
Gracefully cancels an invocation. The invocation is terminated, but its progress is persisted, allowing consistency guarantees to be maintained.
For more information, see the [cancellation documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/services/invocation/managing-invocations#cancel).

202.description: Cancellation request accepted and will be processed asynchronously

patch.description:
Creates a new invocation from a completed invocation, optionally copying partial progress from the original invocation's journal.
The new invocation will have a different invocation ID. Use the `from` parameter to specify how much of the original journal to preserve.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
From which entry index the invocation should restart from.
By default the invocation restarts from the beginning (equivalent to 'from = 0'), retaining only the input of the original invocation.
When greater than 0, the new invocation will copy the old journal prefix up to 'from' included, plus eventual completions for commands in the given prefix.
If the journal prefix contains commands that have not been completed, this operation will fail.

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.description:
When restarting from journal prefix, provide a deployment id to use to replace the currently pinned deployment id.
If 'latest', use the latest deployment id. If 'keep', keeps the pinned deployment id.
When not provided, the invocation will resume on latest.
Note: this parameter can be used only in combination with 'from'.

200.description: Invocation restarted successfully with a new invocation ID

400.description: The selected deployment id to restart as new the invocation doesn't support the currently pinned service protocol version.

patch.description:
Resumes a paused or suspended invocation. If the invocation is backing off due to a retry, this will immediately trigger the retry.
Optionally, you can change the deployment ID that will be used when the invocation resumes. For more information see [resume documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/services/invocation/managing-invocations#resume)

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.description:
When resuming from paused/suspended, provide a deployment id to use to replace the currently pinned deployment id.
If 'latest', use the latest deployment id. If 'keep', keeps the pinned deployment id.
When not provided, the invocation will resume on the pinned deployment id.
When provided and the invocation is either running, or no deployment is pinned, this operation will fail.

400.description: The selected deployment id to resume the invocation doesn't support the currently pinned service protocol version.

get.description: Returns a list of all registered services, including their metadata and configuration.

200.description: List of all registered services with their metadata

get.description: Returns detailed metadata about a specific service, including its type, handlers, and configuration settings.

200.description: Service metadata including type, revision, handlers, and configuration

patch.description:
Updates the configuration of a registered service, such as public visibility, retention policies, and timeout settings.
Note: Service re-discovery will update these settings based on the service endpoint configuration.

get.description: Returns a list of all handlers (methods) available in the specified service.

200.description: List of handlers available in the service

get.description: Returns detailed metadata about a specific handler within a service, including its input/output types and handler type.

200.description: Handler metadata including input/output types and configuration

post.description: Modifies the K/V state of a Virtual Object. For a detailed description of this API and how to use it, see the [state documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/operate/invocation#modifying-service-state).

202.description: State modification request accepted and will be applied asynchronously

get.description: Returns a list of all registered subscriptions, optionally filtered by source or sink.

parameters.name: sink
parameters.description: Filter by the exact specified sink.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Filter by the exact specified source.

200.description: List of subscriptions matching the filter criteria

post.description:
Creates a new subscription that connects an event source (e.g., a Kafka topic) to a Restate service handler.
For more information, see the [subscription documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/operate/invocation#managing-kafka-subscriptions).

get.description: Returns the details of a specific subscription, including its source, sink, and configuration options.

200.description: Subscription details including source, sink, and options

delete.description: Deletes a subscription. This will stop events from the source from being forwarded to the sink.

202.description: Subscription deletion accepted and will be processed asynchronously

get.description: Returns the server version, supported Admin API versions, and the advertised ingress endpoint.

200.description: Server version information including supported API versions and ingress endpoint.

get.description: Get payload data for a specific journal entry. This endpoint returns the potentially large payload fields (parameters, value, failure, headers) that are excluded from the lite journal response. Use this for on-demand loading of payload data.

200.description: Payload data for the journal entry

get.summary: Get Virtual Object inbox inbox for a key
get.description: Get Virtual Object inbox inbox for a key

post.description: Kill multiple invocations in batch. All operations execute in parallel and results are collected.
Cancel multiple invocations in batch. All operations execute in parallel and results are collected.
Purge multiple completed invocations in batch. All operations execute in parallel and results are collected.
Purge journals for multiple completed invocations in batch. All operations execute in parallel and results are collected.
Restart multiple invocations as new in batch. All operations execute in parallel and results are collected.
Resume multiple paused or suspended invocations in batch. All operations execute in parallel and results are collected.
Pause multiple running invocations in batch. All operations execute in parallel and results are collected.

AdvertisedAddress-http-ingress-server_Ht.title: advertised address
AdvertisedAddress-http-ingress-server_Ht.description: An externally accessible URI address for http-ingress-server. This can be set to unix:restate-data/ingress.sock to advertise the automatically created unix-socket instead of using tcp if needed

oneOf.description: Embedded metadata cluster health if it was enabled

sink.description:

Sink uri. Accepted forms:

source.description:
# Source

Source uri. Accepted forms:

* `kafka://<cluster_name>/<topic_name>`, e.g. `kafka://my-cluster/my-topic`

ErrorDescriptionResponse.description:
# Error description response

Error details of the response

restate_code.description:
# Restate code

Restate error code describing this error

abort_timeout.description:
# Abort timeout

This timer guards against stalled service/handler invocations that are supposed to
terminate. The abort timeout is started after the 'inactivity timeout' has expired
and the service/handler invocation has been asked to gracefully terminate. Once the
timer expires, it will abort the service/handler invocation.

This timer potentially **interrupts** user code. If the user code needs longer to
gracefully terminate, then this value needs to be set accordingly.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

If set, it overrides the value set in the service.

documentation.description:
# Documentation

Documentation of the handler, as propagated by the SDKs.

enable_lazy_state.description:
# Enable lazy state

If true, lazy state will be enabled for all invocations to this service.
This is relevant only for Workflows and Virtual Objects.

If set, it overrides the value set in the service.

idempotency_retention.description:
# Idempotency retention

The retention duration of idempotent requests for this handler. If set, it overrides the value set in the service.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

inactivity_timeout.description:
# Inactivity timeout

This timer guards against stalled service/handler invocations. Once it expires,
Restate triggers a graceful termination by asking the service invocation to
suspend (which preserves intermediate progress).

The 'abort timeout' is used to abort the invocation, in case it doesn't react to
the request to suspend.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

If set, it overrides the value set in the service.

info.description:
# Info

List of configuration/deprecation information related to this handler.

input_description.description:
# Human readable input description

If empty, no schema was provided by the user at discovery time.

input_json_schema.description:
# Input JSON Schema

JSON Schema of the handler input

journal_retention.description:
# Journal retention

The journal retention. When set, this applies to all requests to this handler.

In case the invocation has an idempotency key, the `idempotency_retention` caps the maximum `journal_retention` time.
In case this handler is a workflow handler, the `workflow_completion_retention` caps the maximum `journal_retention` time.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

If set, it overrides the value set in the service.

metadata.description:
# Metadata

Additional handler metadata, as propagated by the SDKs.

output_description.description:
# Human readable output description

If empty, no schema was provided by the user at discovery time.

output_json_schema.description:
# Output JSON Schema

JSON Schema of the handler output

public.description:
# Public

If true, this handler can be invoked through the ingress.
If false, this handler can be invoked only from another Restate service.

retry_policy.description:
# Retry policy

Retry policy overrides applied for this handler.

oneOf.description:
# Type

The handler type.

exponentiation_factor.description:
# Factor

The factor to use to compute the next retry attempt.

initial_interval.description:
# Initial Interval

Initial interval for the first retry attempt.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

max_attempts.description:
# Max attempts

Number of maximum attempts (including the initial) before giving up. Infinite retries if unset. No retries if set to 1.

max_interval.description:
# Max interval

Maximum interval between retries.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

oneOf.description:
# On max attempts

Behavior when max attempts are reached.

ListServiceHandlersResponse.description: List of all the handlers of a service

abort_timeout.description:
# Abort timeout

This timer guards against stalled service/handler invocations that are supposed to
terminate. The abort timeout is started after the 'inactivity timeout' has expired
and the service/handler invocation has been asked to gracefully terminate. Once the
timer expires, it will abort the service/handler invocation.

This timer potentially **interrupts** user code. If the user code needs longer to
gracefully terminate, then this value needs to be set accordingly.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

This overrides the default abort timeout set in invoker options.

idempotency_retention.description:
# Idempotency retention

Modify the retention of idempotent requests for this service.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

inactivity_timeout.description:
# Inactivity timeout

This timer guards against stalled service/handler invocations. Once it expires,
Restate triggers a graceful termination by asking the service invocation to
suspend (which preserves intermediate progress).

The 'abort timeout' is used to abort the invocation, in case it doesn't react to
the request to suspend.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

This overrides the default inactivity timeout set in invoker options.

journal_retention.description:
# Journal retention

Modify the journal retention for this service. When set, this applies to all requests to all handlers of this service.

In case the invocation has an idempotency key, the `idempotency_retention` caps the maximum `journal_retention` time.
In case the invocation targets a workflow handler, the `workflow_completion_retention` caps the maximum `journal_retention` time.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

public.description:
# Public

If true, the service can be invoked through the ingress.
If false, the service can be invoked only from another Restate service.

workflow_completion_retention.description:
# Workflow completion retention

Modify the retention of the workflow completion. This can be modified only for workflow services!

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

new_state.description:
# New State

The new state to replace the previous state with

object_key.description:
# Service key

To what virtual object key to apply this change

version.description:
# Version

If set, the latest version of the state is compared with this value and the operation will fail
when the versions differ.

query.description: SQL query to run against the storage

oneOf.title: RegisterHttpDeploymentRequest
oneOf.description: Register HTTP deployment request

# Additional headers

Additional headers added to every discover/invoke request to the deployment.

You typically want to include here API keys and other tokens required to send requests to deployments.

breaking.description:
# Breaking

If `true`, it allows registering new service revisions with
schemas incompatible with previous service revisions, such as changing service type, removing a handler, etc.

See the [versioning documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/operate/versioning) for more information.

dry_run.description:
# Dry-run mode

If `true`, discovery will run but the deployment will not be registered.
This is useful to see the impact of a new deployment before registering it.
`force` and `breaking` will be respected.

force.description:
# Force

If `true`, it overrides, if existing, any deployment using the same `uri`.
Beware that this can lead inflight invocations to an unrecoverable error state.

When set to `true`, it implies `breaking = true`.

See the [versioning documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/operate/versioning) for more information.

uri.description:
# Uri

Uri to use to discover/invoke the http deployment.

use_http_11.description:
# Use http1.1

If `true`, discovery will be attempted using a client that defaults to HTTP1.1
instead of a prior-knowledge HTTP2 client. HTTP2 may still be used for TLS servers
that advertise HTTP2 support via ALPN. HTTP1.1 deployments will only work in
request-response mode.

oneOf.title: RegisterLambdaDeploymentRequest
oneOf.description: Register Lambda deployment request

# Additional headers

Additional headers added to every discover/invoke request to the deployment.

arn.description:
# ARN

ARN to use to discover/invoke the lambda deployment.

assume_role_arn.description:
# Assume role ARN

Optional ARN of a role to assume when invoking the addressed Lambda, to support role chaining

breaking.description:
# Breaking

If `true`, it allows registering new service revisions with
schemas incompatible with previous service revisions, such as changing service type, removing a handler, etc.

See the [versioning documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/operate/versioning) for more information.

dry_run.description:
# Dry-run mode

If `true`, discovery will run but the deployment will not be registered.
This is useful to see the impact of a new deployment before registering it.
`force` and `breaking` will be respected.

force.description:
# Force

If `true`, it overrides, if existing, any deployment using the same `uri`.
Beware that this can lead inflight invocations to an unrecoverable error state.

This implies `breaking = true`.

See the [versioning documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/operate/versioning) for more information.

info.description:
# Info

List of configuration/deprecation information related to this deployment.

max_protocol_version.description:
# Maximum Service Protocol version

During registration, the SDKs declare a range from minimum (included) to maximum (included) Service Protocol supported version.

min_protocol_version.description:
# Minimum Service Protocol version

During registration, the SDKs declare a range from minimum (included) to maximum (included) Service Protocol supported version.

sdk_version.description:
# SDK version

SDK library and version declared during registration.

RestartAsNewInvocationResponse.description: The invocation was restarted as new.

new_invocation_id.description: The invocation id of the new invocation.

SerdeableHeaderHashMap.description:
Proxy type to implement HashMap<HeaderName, HeaderValue> ser/de
Use it directly or with `#[serde(with = "serde_with::As::<serde_with::FromInto<restate_serde_util::SerdeableHeaderMap>>")]`.

abort_timeout.description:
# Abort timeout

This timer guards against stalled service/handler invocations that are supposed to
terminate. The abort timeout is started after the 'inactivity timeout' has expired
and the service/handler invocation has been asked to gracefully terminate. Once the
timer expires, it will abort the service/handler invocation.

This timer potentially **interrupts** user code. If the user code needs longer to
gracefully terminate, then this value needs to be set accordingly.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

If unset, this returns the default abort timeout configured in invoker options.

deployment_id.description:
# Deployment Id

Deployment exposing the latest revision of the service.

documentation.description:
# Documentation

Documentation of the service, as propagated by the SDKs.

enable_lazy_state.description:
# Enable lazy state

If true, lazy state will be enabled for all invocations to this service.
This is relevant only for Workflows and Virtual Objects.

idempotency_retention.description:
# Idempotency retention

The retention duration of idempotent requests for this service.

If not configured, this returns the default idempotency retention.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

inactivity_timeout.description:
# Inactivity timeout

This timer guards against stalled service/handler invocations. Once it expires,
Restate triggers a graceful termination by asking the service invocation to
suspend (which preserves intermediate progress).

The 'abort timeout' is used to abort the invocation, in case it doesn't react to
the request to suspend.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

If unset, this returns the default inactivity timeout configured in invoker options.

info.description:
# Info

List of configuration/deprecation information related to this service.

journal_retention.description:
# Journal retention

The journal retention. When set, this applies to all requests to all handlers of this service.

In case the invocation has an idempotency key, the `idempotency_retention` caps the maximum `journal_retention` time.
In case the invocation targets a workflow handler, the `workflow_completion_retention` caps the maximum `journal_retention` time.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

metadata.description:
# Metadata

Additional service metadata, as propagated by the SDKs.

name.description:
# Name

Fully qualified name of the service

public.description:
# Public

If true, the service can be invoked through the ingress.
If false, the service can be invoked only from another Restate service.

retry_policy.description:
# Retry policy

Retry policy applied to invocations of this service.

If unset, it returns the default values configured in the Restate configuration.

revision.description:
# Revision

Latest revision of the service.

workflow_completion_retention.description:
# Workflow completion retention

The retention duration of workflows. Only available on workflow services.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

exponentiation_factor.description:
# Factor

The factor to use to compute the next retry attempt. Default: `2.0`.

initial_interval.description:
# Initial Interval

Initial interval for the first retry attempt.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

max_attempts.description:
# Max attempts

Number of maximum attempts (including the initial) before giving up. Infinite retries if unset. No retries if set to 1.

max_interval.description:
# Max interval

Maximum interval between retries.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

on_max_attempts.description:
# On max attempts

Behavior when max attempts are reached.

oneOf.title: UpdateHttpDeploymentRequest
oneOf.description: Update HTTP deployment request

# Additional headers

Additional headers added to the discover/invoke requests to the deployment.
When provided, this will overwrite all the headers previously configured for this deployment.

dry_run.description:
# Dry-run mode

If `true`, discovery will run but the deployment will not be registered.
This is useful to see the impact of a new deployment before registering it.

overwrite.description:
# Overwrite

If `true`, the update will overwrite the schema information, including the exposed service and handlers and service configuration, allowing **breaking changes** too. Use with caution.

uri.description:
# Uri

Uri to use to discover/invoke the http deployment.

use_http_11.description:
# Use http1.1

If `true`, discovery will be attempted using a client that defaults to HTTP1.1
instead of a prior-knowledge HTTP2 client. HTTP2 may still be used for TLS servers
that advertise HTTP2 support via ALPN. HTTP1.1 deployments will only work in
request-response mode.

oneOf.title: UpdateLambdaDeploymentRequest
oneOf.description: Update Lambda deployment request

# Additional headers

Additional headers added to the discover/invoke requests to the deployment.
When provided, this will overwrite all the headers previously configured for this deployment.

arn.description:
# ARN

ARN to use to discover/invoke the lambda deployment.

assume_role_arn.description:
# Assume role ARN

Optional ARN of a role to assume when invoking the addressed Lambda, to support role chaining.

dry_run.description:
# Dry-run mode

If `true`, discovery will run but the deployment will not be registered.
This is useful to see the impact of a new deployment before registering it.

overwrite.description:
# Overwrite

If `true`, the update will overwrite the schema information, including the exposed service and handlers and service configuration, allowing **breaking changes** too. Use with caution.

oneOf.description:
# Ingress endpoint

Ingress endpoint that the Web UI should use to interact with.

max_admin_api_version.description:
# Max admin API version

Maximum supported admin API version by the admin server

min_admin_api_version.description:
# Min admin API version

Minimum supported admin API version by the admin server

version.description:
# Admin server version

Version of the admin server

deployment.description: Deployment selection strategy: 'keep' uses the current deployment, 'latest' uses the latest deployment
Deployment selection strategy: 'keep' uses the current deployment, 'latest' uses the latest deployment

error.description: The error message for this invocation

failedInvocationIds.description: List of invocation IDs that failed to process with their error messages

hasMore.description: Whether there are more pages available (only for filter-based requests)

lastCreatedAt.description: The created_at timestamp of the last invocation in the current page, used for pagination

invocation_ids.description: List of invocation IDs to operate on (max 1000)
List of invocation IDs to resume (max 1000)

deployment.description: Deployment ID to use when resuming (applies to all invocations)

invocation_ids.description: List of invocation IDs to restart (max 1000)

deployment.description: Deployment ID to use (applies to all invocations)

oneOf.description: Keep the currently pinned deployment
Use the latest deployment
A specific deployment ID

PatchDeploymentId.description: Specifies which deployment to use when resuming or restarting an invocation

succeeded.description: Invocation IDs that were successfully processed

failed.description: Invocations that failed with error details

succeeded.description: Successfully restarted invocations with their new IDs

failed.description: Invocations that failed with error details

JournalEntryPayloads.description: Payload data for a journal entry. Contains the potentially large fields that are excluded from the lite journal response.

parameters.description: Input parameters for Input, Call, and OneWayCall entries

value.description: Success result value for completed entries (Run, Call, GetState, Output, Awakeable, etc.)

failure.description: Failure details when the entry result is a failure

headers.description: HTTP headers for Input, Call, and OneWayCall entries
